title: Improve readability of “Why I Love You” modal text after opening

requirements.summary: Add a stronger, high-contrast background treatment behind each sequentially revealed love line in the “Why I Love You” modal while preserving copy, animation behavior, scrollability, and correct modal layering/close behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user clicks “Why I Love You ❤️”, the modal content text is clearly readable with a high-contrast background treatment behind it (e.g., stronger frosted panel or a dedicated darker/translucent text panel).
The sequential fade-in behavior of the 5 lines remains intact; readability improvements apply to lines as they appear.
On small mobile screens, no modal text overlaps other UI elements; if content exceeds viewport height, the modal body remains scrollable and usable.
Modal layering is correct (modal and its background overlay sit above the proposal screen), and taps/clicks outside the modal still close it while clicks inside do not.

file_operations.description:
Improve readability by adding a dedicated high-contrast line background (e.g., a dark/translucent rounded panel behind each

line) while keeping the existing loveLines copy unchanged and preserving the current per-line fade-in timing/opacity transitions. Adjust modal layout so the close button does not overlap content on small screens (e.g., switch to an absolute-positioned close control and add appropriate top padding), keep the modal body scrollable within the viewport, and preserve outside-click-to-close with inside click stopPropagation and correct z-index layering.

Add/adjust global utility styles to support the modal’s improved text readability (e.g., a reusable utility for a darker/translucent frosted text panel and optional subtle text shadow for contrast) while respecting mobile-first styling and the existing prefers-reduced-motion behavior.
